text: Joseph Clemens Ruby (March 30, 1933 â€“ August 26, 2020) was an American animator, television editor, writer, and producer. He was the co-founder with Ken Spears of television animation production company Ruby-Spears Productions. He was born in Los Angeles. He helped create Scooby-Doo, Dynomutt, Dog Wonder, and Jabberjaw. Ruby died of natural causes on August 26, 2020 in Los Angeles, aged 87. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American animators Category:American television producers Category:American television writers Category:American editors Category:Businesspeople from Los Angeles
title: Joe Ruby
